comment.author: 31580040@N04
comment._content: More about Field Marshal Frederick Sleigh Roberts, 1st Earl Roberts, Bt, VC, KG, KP, GCB, OM, GCSI, GCIE, KStJ, PC (30 September 1832 – 14 November 1914) here. en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Frederick_Roberts,_1st_Earl_Roberts

comment.author: 76016463@N00
comment._content: "Field Marshal Lord Roberts died of pneumonia at St Omer, France, while visiting Indian troops fighting in the First World War. After lying in state in St. Paul's Cathedral (one of two non-Royals to do so during the 20th century, the other being Sir Winston Churchill), he was given a state funeral."

comment.author: 34904489@N07
comment._content:
Retired at last and artolog,

Thank you for the additional information on Lord Roberts. We will add a bit more detail to the record when we update.
